meanings.definition: A person, typically young, who rejects the conventional values of society and advocates love, peace, and freedom.
meanings.sent1: The hippy at the music festival wore colorful tie-dye clothes.
meanings.sent2: My aunt used to be a hippy in the 1960s, spreading messages of peace.
meanings.sent3: The hippy decided to start a community garden to promote love and unity.
meanings.sent4: Her free spirit made her stand out like a hippy in a crowd of suits.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hippy dancing barefoot in the meadow stayed with me.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of hippies.
meanings.sent1: She decorated her room with hippy posters and dreamcatchers.
meanings.sent2: The music had a hippy vibe, with its peaceful melodies.
meanings.sent3: The hippy-themed party had guests wearing flower crowns and bell-bottoms.
meanings.sent4: The hippy lifestyle embraced nature and simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The hippy culture of the 60s left a lasting impact on society.
